title: Static HTML site — no JS framework
query: Audit https://example.com — it's a plain HTML site with no JavaScript framework
setup: Site is plain HTML + CSS. No React, Vue, or any JS framework. Files are .html with inline styles. Audit finds: 3 images missing alt text, 1 form with no labels, color contrast failure on the footer. No package.json exists.
expected_behavior: Completes the audit without requiring framework detection or package.json
Does NOT assume a JS framework is present — framework_detected should be null or 'unknown'
Uses generic HTML fix patterns from references/fix-patterns.md, not React or framework-specific patterns
Correctly proposes inline HTML fixes (adding alt attributes, label elements) not JSX or component syntax
Loads references/source-patterns.md and correctly identifies .html files as the target for fixes
Does NOT search for .tsx, .vue, or .liquid files when framework is undetected
Reports all 3 findings (missing alt, missing labels, color contrast) correctly

model_notes.all_agents: Verify the agent falls back gracefully to generic HTML patterns when no framework is detected. It must not hallucinate a framework or apply JSX syntax to plain HTML files.
